definition: letter written in one's own blood, expressing determination, hatred, last wishes etc
blood/colloquial pr. [xie3]/CL:滴[di1],片[pian4]
abbr. for 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
book/letter/document/CL:本[ben3],冊|册[ce4],部[bu4]/to write

sentences.english: Why do they admire works written in blood?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼他們讚美鮮血書就的功業？

sentences.english: Heng heng sent disciple received white temples of enunciating theirs trapped longquan casting sword valley.
sentences.chinese: 恆山派弟子收到白衣庵的血書掌門被困龍泉鑄劍谷。

definition: no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
(Buddhism) predestined relationship
long-cherished wish
to be neither too familiar nor too distant/to keep sb at arm's length
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
shortly thereafter/for a moment
to bawl/to wail/to cry
full of youthful vigor (idiom)/in the prime of youth
ready to die to preserve one's chastity
falsetto/opposite: natural or true voice 真聲|真声[zhen1 sheng1]
incurable/incorrigible/beyond cure/hopeless
lit. a white cloud transforms into what looks like a gray dog (idiom)/fig. the unpredictable changeability of the world
illusion (Buddhism)/pipe dream
to have no other choice/to be the last resort
